sub_topic: Using the Fourier transform to analyze the frequency content of a signal
message_1: A signal f(t) is given by f(t) = 2sin(100πt) + 5cos(300πt). Use Fourier transform to find the frequency content of the signal in Hz.
message_2:
The given signal f(t) is already in the time domain and consists of two sinusoidal components with different frequencies. To find the frequency content of the signal, we can simply identify the frequencies of the individual components.

The first component is 2sin(100πt). The angular frequency (ω) is given by 100π rad/s. To convert this to frequency (f) in Hz, we use the formula:

f = ω / (2π)

For the first component:

f1 = (100π) / (2π) = 50 Hz

The second component is 5cos(300πt). The angular frequency (ω) is given by 300π rad/s. To convert this to frequency (f) in Hz, we use the same formula:

For the second component:

f2 = (300π) / (2π) = 150 Hz

So, the frequency content of the signal f(t) consists of two frequencies: 50 Hz and 150 Hz.
